poem:
**Morning Headlines**  

The map is a broken jigsaw,  
pieces scattered by hands—  
not at play, but at war. 

In the distance, the echo  
of sirens curls like smoke  
around the roots of ruin.

We count breaths,  
trace lines of shadow  
on the thin covers of debris,  
wonder if another morning  
will ever arrive whole.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Middle East crisis live: Iran warns UN about Israel’s threats against its nuclear sites; Israel launch strikes across Lebanon 11.02am BST 10.54am BST Israeli forces blew up homes and besieged schools and shelters for displaced people on Monday as they deepened their operations in Jabalia in the northern Gaza Strip, residents and medics said. They also rounded up men and ordered women to leave the camp, they said. Medics at the Indonesian hospital told Reuters". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
